message:
RIP Global Assembly Cache (RIP Strong Naming as well)

RT @Meligy: "@nikmd23: R.I.P. Global Assembly Cache. http://t.co/37V85gurOG"
story: Meligy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: RIP, GAC
caption: ripgac.net
description: On May 13th, 2014, family and friends of the Microsoft .NET Global Assembly Cache announced that it is losing its long battle with runaway bloat, and has gone into a coma from which it is unlikely to recover.

data.message: The new so-called cloud-optimized .NET framework,  which is the recommended platform for ASP.NET vNext, does not use the GAC. Click on the link for the details.
It was written on the wall since the introduction of nuget
Yes, that's what Phil Haack talked about.  It's several years of incremental effort to get ready for it.
But strong naming still lives on, I think nuget packages still require strong named assemblies.
بس مش الـ NuGet packages بـ versions مختلفة هتبقى محفوظة في مكان ما مشترك على السيرفر بدل تكرارها في كل application؟ مش دي كدا هتبقى زي الـ GAC ؟
No. Not required for NuGet. I know many OSS projects that were asked to add it to existing packages.
The discovery is different.  No magic or automatic inclusion. Easier to manage multiple versions too.
As well as finding updates to your packages

Regarding SN. OSS devs were hitting on David Fowler for official word saying SN is bad so they can use when rejecting SN requests. Having ASP.NET vNext without SN is the first acknowledgment of that sort.
